shortlist.name: Wild Dahlia
shortlist.rationale: Market leader with consistent recent form showing 3rd and 4th placings. Haggas stable in excellent form and Fallon is a top-class jockey. Short odds reflect genuine winning chance.

shortlist.name: Red Tsarina
shortlist.rationale: Strong recent form with 2nd and 1st placings showing clear improvement. Loughnane riding well and odds suggest genuine contender. Form trend is upward.

shortlist.name: Pretty Ambitious (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Last run produced a solid 2nd place finish. At reasonable odds for a horse showing winning form. Haynes stable capable of improvement.

shortlist.name: Lady Kodiac (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Comes here with the best recent form, having won last time and placed previously. Represents a respected yard and is clear favourite in the market, indicating strong confidence. No signs of needing major improvement and has proven ability at this level.

shortlist.name: Dandy Speed (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with a close third and fourth in last two starts, suggesting reliability and readiness. Top jockey booking and trainer in good form. Odds indicate strong market support and value for a runner with proven ability at this level.

shortlist.name: Houdini Miss (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent form includes two wins and a second, showing ability to compete and win at this grade. Consistent performances and market support suggest she is expected to run well again. Connections are in decent form and the odds reflect strong confidence.

shortlist.name: Mallorca
shortlist.rationale: Strong connections with Gosden yard, top young jockey, and solid debut form (2nd). Short odds reflect high market confidence and class edge. No signs of needing major improvement.

shortlist.name: Freddie's Star (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Progressive form (2nd, then 3rd), proven race fitness, and competitive odds. Connections are solid and recent runs suggest further improvement is possible without needing a leap in ability.

shortlist.name: Summertime Blues
shortlist.rationale: Arrives in peak form with two consecutive wins and strong recent placings, representing a top trainer-jockey combination. The odds reflect strong market confidence and the horse is proven at this level, with no sign of decline in recent runs.

shortlist.name: Profit Street (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistently competitive in recent starts, holding form in higher grade company. Market support is strong, indicating stable confidence. Connections are in good form and the horse has shown ability to handle this type of surface and class.

shortlist.name: Rusheen Boy
shortlist.rationale: Recent win two starts ago and generally reliable profile at this level. Form is solid and the odds suggest genuine market respect. No major negatives in recent runs and should be suited by conditions.

shortlist.name: Parish Councillor (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Arrives in peak form with back-to-back wins, showing clear progression and consistency. Connections are strong, and the odds reflect justified market confidence. No sign of regression and holds the best recent profile in the field.

shortlist.name: Offiah's Boy
shortlist.rationale: Recent form includes two wins and two seconds in last six starts, indicating ability at this level. Last two runs were below best but remains well-treated and has a top jockey booked. Odds offer value for a proven winner if returning to peak.

shortlist.name: Tuesdays Child
shortlist.rationale: Joint market leader with consistent recent form showing 3rd, 3rd, 4th placings. George Boughey stable in good form and Billy Loughnane is a capable jockey. Form suggests ready to strike.

shortlist.name: Sansanetti (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Strong recent form with 9th, 1st, 1st, 7th, 2nd, 1st sequence showing winning ability. Two recent wins demonstrate current fitness and form. Joint favourite status reflects market confidence.

shortlist.name: Mandana (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent win (1st) followed by consistent placings (2nd, 2nd, 4th). Hollie Doyle booking adds significant value - top-class jockey often secures best rides. Form cycle suggests another big run due.

shortlist.name: Coedana (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile with back-to-back wins and consistent recent form. Connections are in good order and the odds reflect strong market confidence. No sign of regression and should be at peak fitness.

shortlist.name: Team Player
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer with recent win and placed efforts. Odds indicate clear market respect and form is solid for this grade. Reliable connections and no need for major improvement to contend.

shortlist.name: Hood Wink
shortlist.rationale: Market leader with solid recent form including a 4th and 2nd in last two starts. Tim Easterby yard in good form and James Sullivan is a capable jockey. The 5 represents a poor run but bounced back well with consistent placings.

shortlist.name: Due To Shine
shortlist.rationale: Strong recent form with a win (0) and 2nd place finish in last two outings after disappointing 8th. Shows ability to bounce back from poor runs and Brian Ellison horses often improve for racing.

shortlist.name: Loose Connection (Usa)
shortlist.rationale: Recent winner (0) with Michael Bell training, who has good strike rate. The 9 before the win suggests inconsistency but the victory shows current ability. American-bred horses often have different racing patterns.

shortlist.name: Magic Box (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with multiple wins and places, trained by William Haggas who has a strong record at Newcastle. Jason Hart is a reliable jockey. The horse is proven at this level and distance, and current odds reflect strong market support.

shortlist.name: First Time (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile with a win last time out and solid placed efforts prior. Connections are in good form and the horse is unexposed compared to rivals. Odds indicate strong market confidence and the form suggests further improvement is likely.

shortlist.name: Corinth
shortlist.rationale: Corinth is a well-bred Gosden runner with a win and a recent run, indicating fitness. The form (4th, 1st, then a layoff) is solid for this level, and the connections are top class. The odds reflect clear market confidence and superiority over this field.

shortlist.name: Faeberon (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Faeberon represents a respected yard and is the only other runner with single-figure odds. The debut run was educational and improvement is expected, especially with the stable’s strong record with second-time starters. Market support suggests ability.

shortlist.name: Al Joory (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Market leader with strong connections. Roger Varian stable in good form and Jack Mitchell is a reliable jockey. Recent 4th suggests fitness after layoff, with previous winning form evident in the string.

shortlist.name: Galaxy Zoo
shortlist.rationale: Ralph Beckett trained with consistent recent form including a win (1) in the sequence. The 8th last time may have been over wrong trip or conditions. Strong trainer-jockey combination with proven winning ability.

shortlist.name: Jewelry (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: William Haggas is a top-class trainer with recent winning form (1) in the sequence. The 8th and 9th may not reflect true ability if conditions or distance were unsuitable. Each-way value at current odds.

shortlist.name: Mattice
shortlist.odds_note: 7/2 SBK, 5.3 Exchange (solid market support, not a longshot)
shortlist.rationale: Mattice arrives in winning form, having scored last time out and showing consistent improvement in recent runs. The jockey is reliable and the trainer has a good record at this venue. Odds indicate strong market confidence, and the horse does not require major improvement to contend.

shortlist.name: Let's Go Hugo (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Let's Go Hugo (Ire) won two starts back and was runner-up last time, indicating peak form. Connections are solid, and the odds reflect genuine market respect. The horse has proven ability at this level and does not need to improve to be a major player.

shortlist.name: Startling
shortlist.rationale: Startling has been ultra-consistent, finishing in the top three in six of the last seven starts and winning last time out. The trainer is respected and the jockey is experienced. Current odds offer fair value for a horse in reliable form.

shortlist.name: Miss Rainbow (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Miss Rainbow (Ire) has a strong recent record with multiple wins and placings, showing consistency at this level. The odds are competitive and connections have a solid local record. The horse is fit and does not require major improvement.

shortlist.name: Call Me Betty (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 2/1 SBK, 2.2 exchange (clear market leader, strong support)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with multiple placings and a win in last six starts. Proven at this level and trip, holding form well without signs of regression. Connections are reliable, and current odds reflect strong market confidence.

shortlist.name: Anthropologist
shortlist.rationale: Regularly in the frame with several seconds and thirds, indicating reliability and competitiveness at this grade. Trainer and jockey combination is respected. Market position suggests expectations of another strong run.

shortlist.name: Ey Up He's A Star
shortlist.rationale: Recent win and consistent placed efforts show current peak form. No major negatives in profile, and odds indicate strong support. Connections have been in good form recently.

shortlist.name: Seed Investor (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 5/2 SBK, 3.25 exchange (clear favourite, strong market support)
shortlist.rationale: Returned to winning ways last time, showing clear improvement and fitness. Consistent profile with a recent win, and connections are in solid form. Market support is strong, indicating confidence.

shortlist.name: Terrapin
shortlist.odds_note: 4/1 SBK, 4.8 exchange (well-backed, second choice in market)
shortlist.rationale: Lightly raced and progressive, with a good second last time out. Trainer and jockey are both reliable at this level. Still unexposed and open to further improvement.

shortlist.name: Enchanted Queen
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form (placed twice), top connections with Buick and Appleby, and clear market leader. Profile suggests fitness and readiness, with proven ability at this level.

shortlist.name: Lady Roisia
shortlist.rationale: Solid debut placing, progressive trainer, and competitive odds. Connections are reliable and the horse showed promise on first start, indicating scope for improvement without needing a major leap.

shortlist.name: Akirra (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent filly with two solid runs (4th and 2nd), showing clear progression and race fitness. Trained by Clive Cox, who is adept with juveniles, and faces a winnable field. Odds reflect strong market support and realistic chance.

shortlist.name: Zen Diva
shortlist.rationale: Matching Akirra's profile with two promising efforts (4th and 2nd), trained by Ralph Beckett, a proven source of juvenile winners. Hector Crouch is a reliable jockey. Market position and form suggest a leading chance.

shortlist.name: Time To Take Off (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Debutant from a yard with a strong record with newcomers. Market support is significant, indicating positive reports and expectations. While lacking race experience, connections and odds justify inclusion.

shortlist.name: Rum Therapy (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 2/1 SBK, 3.9 exchange (clear market leader, not an outsider)
shortlist.rationale: Comes here in top form, having won two of last three starts and placed in the other. Consistent improver with a strong win record at this level. Connections are in good form and the odds reflect strong market confidence.

shortlist.name: Kesta (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistently hitting the frame with three consecutive third-place finishes after a win and a second. Reliable profile, proven fitness, and trainer in form. Market support suggests another bold showing likely.

shortlist.name: Aberama Gold
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with two wins and a close fourth in last four starts. Top connections in O'Meara and Tudhope, who excel at this level. Odds represent fair value for a horse in form and with proven class.

shortlist.name: Charlie Mason
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile with two wins and a close second in last three starts. Trainer in good form and horse clearly thriving. Odds slightly shorter but justified by upward trajectory and fitness.

shortlist.name: Bona Fortuna (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer with multiple placed efforts, including a close second last time out. Trainer/jockey combination solid at this level. Odds offer each-way value for a horse that rarely runs a bad race.

shortlist.name: Gentle Warrior (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 2/1 SBK, 2.96 exchange (clear favourite, solid market support)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with two wins and a third from last three starts. Remains in peak condition and represents a strong yard. No signs of regression and market confidence is strong.

shortlist.name: Rock N Roll Pinkie
shortlist.rationale: Multiple wins this season, including latest start. Proven ability to win in this grade and maintains form. Connections are reliable and odds are fair for a proven winner.

shortlist.name: Crowd Quake
shortlist.odds_note: Strong market support: 11/4 SBK, 4.0 exchange (clear favourite).
shortlist.rationale: Crowd Quake has outstanding recent form, winning five of his last seven starts and placing in the other two. He is partnered by a reliable jockey and comes from a stable in good form. The odds reflect strong confidence from both bookmakers and the exchange, indicating he is the horse to beat.

shortlist.name: Double Red
shortlist.rationale: Double Red has won twice in his last five starts and comes off a recent win, showing he is in good order. The odds are competitive and suggest he is considered the main danger to the favourite. Connections are respected and the horse has proven ability at this level.

shortlist.name: Harswell Ruby (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with multiple placed efforts, including a close second last time out. Roger Fell is a shrewd trainer and Cam Hardie is a capable jockey. The odds represent fair value for a horse that is clearly in form and not needing major improvement.

shortlist.name: Dream Pirate
shortlist.rationale: Won last time out and has been in the frame in most recent starts. The win came off a similar mark and the form has held up well. Marco Ghiani is a rising star and the odds are attractive for a horse with proven winning form.

shortlist.name: Duke's Command
shortlist.rationale: Won two starts back and has been competitive in better races. David O'Meara is a top northern trainer and Daniel Tudhope is a high-quality jockey. The horse is proven at this level and the odds are fair for a horse with strong connections and recent winning form.

shortlist.name: Runman
shortlist.rationale: Represents top connections with Oisin Murphy riding for the Gosdens, a proven high strike-rate team. Short odds reflect strong market confidence, and with the original favourite withdrawn, Runman is now the clear form and class angle. No major negatives on profile or connections.

shortlist.name: St Anton (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent form figures (placed both starts) suggest reliability and readiness to win soon. Trained by Richard Hannon, who excels with juveniles at this track. Market position is justified by proven ability and scope for improvement.

shortlist.name: Venetia
shortlist.odds_note: 15/4 (SBK), 4.7 (exchange) – respected in betting, not a longshot
shortlist.rationale: Ralph Beckett is a leading trainer at Salisbury, and Rossa Ryan is a strong booking. Venetia is well found in the market and represents a yard with a good record with debutants and unexposed types. Market support suggests ability.

shortlist.name: Poetry Of Time
shortlist.rationale: Highly progressive profile with a promising debut second; top connections (Haggas/Marquand) excel with juveniles at this track. The form is solid, and the odds reflect strong confidence. No signs of needing major improvement, and the market expects further progress.

shortlist.name: Akho Mezzna (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: 5/2 (SBK), 3.7 (exchange) – clear second choice in the market.
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer with three solid runs, including two runner-up finishes. Oisin Murphy is a notable booking, and the horse has shown enough ability to be a danger if the favourite underperforms. No evidence of regression or need for major improvement.

shortlist.name: Decem Starr (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile with a close second last time out, suggesting imminent improvement. Top jockey booking and clear market leader. Connections in good form and no major negatives on recent evidence.

shortlist.name: Illy's Roo (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Second favourite on exchange at 5.1, 15/2 SBK
shortlist.rationale: Market support notable on exchange, suggesting better is expected than debut run. Top jockey booked and trainer capable with juveniles. Likely to improve from debut and respected on connections and odds.

shortlist.name: Tahalel (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Represents a top yard with a reliable jockey. Recent form suggests potential improvement and the odds indicate strong market confidence. Connections are in good form and the horse is not exposed, making it a leading contender.

shortlist.name: Black Chiffon
shortlist.rationale: Debuts for a trainer-jockey combination with a strong record at this level. Market support is notable and connections are respected. Lack of form is offset by the quality of connections and positive betting signals.

shortlist.name: Music Academy (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Trainer excels with newcomers and the horse is well found in the market. No major negatives on profile and connections are in good recent form. Should be ready to run well first time out.

shortlist.name: Queen's Companion
shortlist.rationale: Another well-bred debutant from a top stable. Jockey booking is positive and odds suggest genuine support. Stable's record with similar types is strong, making this runner a credible threat.

shortlist.name: Sword Maker (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Comes in with two wins from last three starts, including a win last time out. Top connections with Oisin Murphy riding for Saeed bin Suroor. Current odds reflect strong market support and form is progressive, suggesting further improvement is likely.

shortlist.name: Pilu (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Unbeaten in two starts, showing clear upward trajectory. While stepping up in class, the unbeaten profile and solid market position make this runner a strong contender. Trainer and jockey both capable at this level.

shortlist.name: Another Abbot (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 11/4 SBK, 4.4 exchange (clear favourite, solid market support)
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile with a recent win and consistent form figures. Top connections with Haggas/Marquand, and current odds reflect strong market confidence. No sign of regression and handles similar company.

shortlist.name: Blue Day
shortlist.odds_note: 4/1 SBK, 5.1 exchange (well found in market, clear second choice)
shortlist.rationale: Recent win three starts back and top jockey booking in Oisin Murphy. Form slightly patchy but has shown ability at this level and odds indicate respect from the market.

shortlist.name: Goodwood Mogul
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with three placings from last four starts, top jockey booking, and strong market support. Connections are reliable and the horse is fit and holding form, making him the most solid contender.

shortlist.name: Approval
shortlist.rationale: Has shown ability at this level, and while recent form is mixed, the booking of Tom Marquand and support in the market suggest a return to form is expected. Connections are strong and the horse is proven at the class.

shortlist.name: Grecian Legacy (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent profile with a win and several placings this season. Recent runs suggest competitiveness at this level. Rossa Ryan is a positive jockey booking and the horse is fit and reliable.

shortlist.name: Promethean (Fr)
shortlist.rationale: Returned to winning form two starts ago and remains competitively priced. Tom Marquand is a strong jockey booking, and the trainer is in good form. Recent win suggests fitness and ability at this level.

shortlist.name: Diamond Bay
shortlist.odds_note: 4/1 SBK, 9.4 exchange (market support, not an outsider)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer with multiple recent placings and a win this season. Daniel Muscutt is a reliable jockey, and the horse has shown ability to handle similar company. Odds indicate respect from the market.

shortlist.name: Hebridean Nomad
shortlist.rationale: Lightly raced this season with solid placed efforts in competitive handicaps. Oisin Murphy is a top jockey, and Andrew Balding is a respected trainer. Form suggests the horse is holding condition and capable at this level.

shortlist.name: Lightning Flash (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Returned from a break with a win last time, indicating peak fitness and readiness. Connections are respected, and the odds reflect strong market support. Recent form is progressive, and the horse is proven at this level.

shortlist.name: Jet Patrol (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Won last time out, showing ability to bounce back after mixed prior form. Sean Bowen is a top jockey, and the trainer is in good recent form. Odds indicate strong market confidence and the horse is fit and in winning form.

shortlist.name: Shantou Lucky (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 1/1 SBK, 2.0 exchange (clear favourite, strong market support)
shortlist.rationale: Arrives in outstanding form with four consecutive wins, indicating peak condition and reliability. The odds reflect strong market confidence. No signs of regression in recent runs, and connections are in good order. No major negatives on profile or recent performance.

shortlist.name: Finn Lough (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 4/1 SBK, 6.0 exchange (solid second choice in market)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer with multiple recent placings and a win, suggesting reliability and competitiveness at this level. Recent runner-up finish confirms current form. Connections are respected and the odds offer fair value for a horse with proven ability.

shortlist.name: Heaven Smart (Fr)
shortlist.rationale: Returned to form with a win last time out, indicating peak fitness and improvement. Top jockey booking and trainer in good recent form. Odds reflect strong market support and current ability.

shortlist.name: Couldbeaweapon (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with multiple placings, suggesting reliability and fitness. Connections have a good record at the track. Odds offer reasonable value for a horse with proven consistency.

shortlist.name: Cawthorne Cracker (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent form includes several placed efforts, indicating competitiveness at this level. Yard is in form and jockey claims useful allowance. Odds suggest market respect for a horse with solid credentials.

shortlist.name: Bluegrass (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 2/1 SBK, 4.1 exchange (market leader, not a longshot)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent winning form last season, including two wins and a second in last six starts. Trainer and jockey have solid records at this level. Recent layoff but returns at a competitive mark and is well supported in the market.

shortlist.name: Yes Indeed (Fr)
shortlist.rationale: Two wins from last four completed starts, including a sequence before a seasonal reappearance 'bounce' (pulled up last time, common after layoff). Sean Bowen is a top jockey and the horse has proven ability at this level.

shortlist.name: Forget The Way
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile last season with a win and placed efforts. Recent runs suggest fitness and consistency. Trainer is in form and the horse is not exposed, offering value at current odds.

shortlist.name: Masked Man (Fr)
shortlist.rationale: Represents top connections with a strong winning record at this level. The market is heavily in his favour, indicating confidence from both bookmakers and exchange backers. No major negatives in profile and connections are in good recent form.

shortlist.name: Queensland Boy (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Despite a pulled-up last run, the odds suggest market respect and potential for improvement. Trainer Ian Williams is capable of readying one for this type of contest, and the horse is not considered a longshot by current market standards.

shortlist.name: An Bradan Feasa (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Favored at 2/1 and 3.1 on the exchange
shortlist.rationale: Recent win and strong form figures suggest a high level of consistency and current form. The odds reflect its status as a top contender.

shortlist.name: Heather Honey
shortlist.odds_note: Competitive odds at 11/4 and 6.2 on the exchange
shortlist.rationale: Recent back-to-back wins indicate strong current form and a good chance of continuing this streak. The odds offer value for its consistent performance.

shortlist.name: Belvedere Blast (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Odds of 9/2 and 6.2 on the exchange
shortlist.rationale: Recent win and decent form figures suggest potential for a strong run. The odds are reasonable for its level of performance.

shortlist.name: Inspector Lynley
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with multiple placed efforts, including a win and two seconds in last six starts. Trainer and jockey are reliable, and the horse is proven at this level. Odds represent fair value for a horse with solid claims.

shortlist.name: Shibuya Song
shortlist.rationale: Has shown ability to compete at this level, with a win and several placed efforts in recent starts. Trainer and jockey have solid records. Current odds offer value for a horse with proven form and connections.

shortlist.name: Scudamore (Fr)
shortlist.rationale: Recent form includes a win and two seconds, suggesting the horse is in good heart. Trainer is in form and the jockey is capable. Odds are on the short side but justified by recent performances.

shortlist.name: Synners Kid (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Returned to form with a win last time, representing a top stable and partnered by a reliable jockey. Recent improvement is clear, and current odds reflect strong market support. No need for major improvement to feature.

shortlist.name: War Saint (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with a solid third last time. Connections are respected, and odds indicate genuine market confidence. Should be competitive if repeating latest effort.

shortlist.name: Blessings To You (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Showed improvement to finish fourth last time and represents a capable yard. Odds are fair for a runner with potential to progress further without needing a dramatic leap in form.

shortlist.name: Tea Rose (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Lightly raced but improving, with a top trainer and a promising jockey. The form figures suggest progression, and the stable is renowned for developing young horses. The odds are fair for a horse with upside and top connections.

shortlist.name: Tswalu (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer with a string of placed efforts, indicating reliability and a strong chance to be in the finish. The trainer is in form, and the horse is proven at this level. The odds reflect a solid each-way chance, but the win record is a slight concern.

shortlist.name: Tina's Charm (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Showed clear improvement last time out (3rd), suggesting she is coming to hand. The trainer is a master with fillies, and the odds offer value for a horse on an upward curve. Not yet proven to win, but the trajectory is positive.

shortlist.name: All Told (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with a close third last time, representing a top stable and partnered by a leading jockey. Proven at this level and holding peak fitness, with odds reflecting strong market confidence.

shortlist.name: Wasittheway (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Solid recent efforts in similar company, holding form and fitness. Consistently competitive and well found in the market, suggesting connections expect a bold run.

shortlist.name: Empress Artemis (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with multiple wins and places, trained by Lyons and ridden by Keane (top connections). Current odds reflect strong market support and realistic winning chance. No signs of decline in form.

shortlist.name: Storm Averted (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent win signals peak fitness and improvement. Trainer/jockey combination has delivered results at this level. Form is progressive and odds offer fair value for a runner in winning form.

shortlist.name: Lismacbryan (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with a 2nd and 5th in last two starts, indicating fitness and competitiveness at this level. Top jockey booking (C. T. Keane) adds confidence. Odds reflect strong market support and realistic winning chance.

shortlist.name: Only Spoofing (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent runner-up finish shows return to form and ability to compete in this grade. Jockey/trainer combination is reliable. Odds suggest genuine contender status.

shortlist.name: Himalayan Heights (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Clear market leader at 11/8 (2.08 exchange), indicating strong support.
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer with a win two starts back and top connections. Recent form includes a win and a respectable effort in a higher grade. Jockey and trainer are both high calibre, and the odds reflect strong market confidence. No major negatives in the profile.

shortlist.name: Angelo Pio (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Second choice in the market at 15/4 (2.5 exchange), solid value.
shortlist.rationale: Solid recent form with two wins and a third in last five starts. Consistently competitive at this level and represents a top yard. Jockey is in good form and the horse is reliable, making him a strong contender if the favourite underperforms.

shortlist.name: Snapretend (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Third in the betting at 4/1 (3.35 exchange), respected in the market.
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile with a win last time out and improving form figures. From a leading stable and appears to be on the upgrade. Market support is notable and connections are strong.

shortlist.name: Arcland (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 3/1 SBK, 3.7 exchange (clear market leader, not an outsider)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with three consecutive runner-up finishes after a win, indicating reliability and fitness. Trained by Gavin Cromwell, a respected yard, and holding strong market support. No sign of decline in form, and connections are in good order.

shortlist.name: Maxwell Smart (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent win two starts ago and a solid second last time out. Consistent performer at this level, showing fitness and reliability. Odds reflect strong market confidence and recent form is peaking at the right time.

shortlist.name: Bhean Saibhre (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 5/1 SBK, 3.4 exchange (solid market position, not an outsider)
shortlist.rationale: Returned from a break with a strong second last time, suggesting improvement and readiness. Trainer is capable, and the horse is well-supported in the market. Recent form is trending upward, making this runner a credible threat.

shortlist.name: Secret Rock (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 13/8 SBK, 3.0 exchange (clear market leader, strong support)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with three consecutive placed efforts, indicating reliability at this level. Top jockey booking (C. T. Keane) and trainer in form. Market support suggests confidence and he does not require major improvement to win.

shortlist.name: Hangry (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 6/1 SBK, 2.88 exchange (well-backed on exchange, value vs. fixed odds)
shortlist.rationale: Recent fourth on seasonal return suggests fitness and potential to build on that effort. Exchange price is notably strong, indicating smart money. Trainer is capable at this level and the horse is not exposed compared to others.

shortlist.name: Spanish John (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 4/1 SBK, 4.1 exchange (solid market position, not a longshot)
shortlist.rationale: Won two starts back and has run in better company. Recent form slightly patchy but retains ability and is proven at this level. Jockey booking is a positive. Represents value if returning to best.

shortlist.name: Jerandme (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent third-place finish signals fitness and readiness. Connections are reliable, and current odds offer fair value for a horse with proven ability at this level.

shortlist.name: Rexem (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form, including a third last time out, suggests the horse is peaking. Trainer is respected and odds are attractive for a runner with solid credentials.

shortlist.name: Court Canyon (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Represents a top stable with a reliable jockey. The odds indicate strong market confidence. Recent form is limited but not poor, and the connections are in excellent form. No major negatives in a weak field.

shortlist.name: Garnetot (Fr)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent runs in better company, now drops in class. Top trainer and jockey combination. Market support is notable and form is competitive for this grade.

shortlist.name: Jeaniemacaroney (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form at a higher level, proven winner, and trained by a top yard. The only recent run (6th) was after a break and can be forgiven. Connections are in form and the odds reflect strong market support.

shortlist.name: Spick And Span (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile with two wins from last four starts, holding form well. Recent 7th can be excused given prior consistency. Represents a stable capable of readying winners at this level.

shortlist.name: Queenofthelodge (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Ultra-consistent with two wins and three seconds in last six starts. Recent 'P' (pulled up) is a concern but otherwise has a strong record at this grade. Market support is notable and connections are respected.

shortlist.name: Hope She Flies (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 5/2 SBK, 4.3 exchange (clear market leader, not an outsider)
shortlist.rationale: Comes here in peak form, having won last time out and showing clear progression. The market support is strong, and the connections are in good order. No need for major improvement to be competitive.

shortlist.name: Demanding Gerry (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with back-to-back runner-up finishes, indicating reliability and readiness. Odds reflect strong market respect. No evidence of needing significant improvement to win at this level.

shortlist.name: Jaadil (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent form is solid with two good efforts in the last four starts. Market support is notable, and the jockey booking is positive. Has shown enough to be a strong contender without needing major improvement.

shortlist.name: Wing Back (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Clear market leader at 9/4 (2.46 exchange), indicating strong support.
shortlist.rationale: Recent form is progressive, with a win and a third from last three starts. Connections are in good order and the horse is peaking at the right time. No need for major improvement and profile fits a likely winner.

shortlist.name: Coffeys Forge (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Solidly backed at 5/1 (4.6 exchange), suggesting respect in the market.
shortlist.rationale: Returned from a break with a win last time, for a top stable. Form is trending upward and the trainer excels with similar types. No major negatives and should be competitive again.

shortlist.name: Ocean Of Mercy (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 7/4 SBK, 2.92 exchange (clear favourite, strong market support)
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile with two consecutive wins, suggesting ongoing improvement. Unexposed compared to rivals and arrives in peak form. Market support is strong, indicating confidence from connections and punters. No signs of regression or need for major improvement.

shortlist.name: What's Up Darling (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Returned to winning ways last time out, indicating a return to form. Top connections (Elliott/Kennedy) add confidence. Consistent performer at this level and odds reflect strong market respect. No major improvement required based on latest win.

shortlist.name: Donnie Devito (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 16/5 SBK, 3.1 exchange (solid market position, not an outsider)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent placer in competitive fields, holding form well. Recent runs show reliability and ability to compete at this level. Odds indicate market respect and suggest he is expected to be in the mix. No evidence of needing major improvement.

shortlist.name: Spellacy's Cross (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with multiple placings this campaign, including several seconds. Has been running regularly, indicating fitness. Unseated last time but otherwise reliable. Odds reflect strong market confidence and suggest connections expect a bold run.

shortlist.name: Sea Of Doubt (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Solid profile with multiple placed efforts this season, including a recent third. Has shown ability to compete at this level and remains consistent. Market support is notable, and the form is reliable for this grade.

shortlist.name: Applejack Poet (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent form includes two thirds this campaign, indicating competitiveness. Fell last time but otherwise has been running respectably. Connections are capable, and odds suggest the horse is expected to be involved if jumping holds up.

shortlist.name: Coeur De Pierre (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Consistently trades as market leader or close second-favorite on major exchanges and books.
shortlist.rationale: Top-class French sprinter with proven Group-level form at Chantilly. Regularly runs well fresh and has a strong record at this venue. Christophe Soumillon is a leading jockey, and the Delcher Sanchez stable is highly respected for targeting these races. Market support is strong, indicating stable confidence.

shortlist.name: Laulne (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Firmly in the first three in all current fixed-odds and exchange markets.
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile with strong recent form in competitive French sprint company. Maxime Guyon is a top jockey booking, and the Barberot yard is in excellent form. Market position reflects genuine winning claims and connections are known for targeting valuable Chantilly sprints.

shortlist.name: Burhan
shortlist.odds_note: Short in the market, consistently among the top three in betting.
shortlist.rationale: Andre Fabre rarely runs one in this grade without strong expectations. Burhan is lightly raced, open to further improvement, and has shown ability in similar company. Market support is notable for a Fabre runner at Chantilly, and the jockey booking is positive.

shortlist.name: Kerkila (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Well found in the market, not an outsider.
shortlist.rationale: Consistent filly with strong recent form lines and a proven record at the course. Mickael Barzalona is a top jockey, and Graffard is a trainer to follow in these events. Market position suggests connections expect a bold run.

shortlist.name: La Delirante (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Prominent in early market, trained by top jumps trainer Nicolle.
shortlist.rationale: Francois Nicolle is a leading trainer at Compiegne, and Kevin Nabet is a top jockey in French jumps racing. Early market support and strong connections suggest readiness and ability at this level.

shortlist.name: Rosefilly Has (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Well found in market, same top stable as La Delirante.
shortlist.rationale: Represents the powerful Nicolle yard with Angelo Zuliani, another elite jumps jockey. Stable form and market position indicate strong chance without need for major improvement.

shortlist.name: Earl Of Shannon (Fr)
shortlist.rationale: Another Nicolle runner, partnered by Bertrand Lestrade, who is highly respected in French jumps. Market signals and stable strength make this a leading contender.

shortlist.name: Kingpark (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Solid market support, top international jockey.
shortlist.rationale: James Reveley is a multiple French champion jockey, and Kingpark is well found in the market. Connections and jockey booking suggest strong chance at this level.

shortlist.name: Nicos Invicta (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Consistently among the market leaders on French exchanges; not a longshot.
shortlist.rationale: Represents the powerful Nicolle yard, which is highly respected at Compiegne. Kevin Nabet is a top jockey booking. Market support suggests strong stable confidence. Connections have a high strike rate in similar conditions.

shortlist.name: Mary Shelley (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Well found in the market, not an outsider.
shortlist.rationale: From the leading Lageneste & Macaire stable, which excels with young jumpers at this venue. Kilian Dubourg is a reliable rider for the yard. Market position indicates strong expectations.

shortlist.name: Metronomique (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Prominent in early betting, not a longshot.
shortlist.rationale: James Reveley is a top international jockey, and the George/Zetterholm partnership is respected for readying horses for French conditions. Market support is notable.

shortlist.name: Mongary (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Expected to be among the market leaders based on trainer reputation and typical market support for Nicolle runners.
shortlist.rationale: Represents the powerful Francois Nicolle yard, which is highly respected at Compiegne and in French jumps racing. Kevin Nabet is a top jockey booking, indicating stable confidence. Even without published recent form, the connections and likely market position make this runner a strong contender.

shortlist.name: Positif (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Likely to be well-supported in the market given stable and jockey combination.
shortlist.rationale: Also from the Nicolle stable, with Angelo Zuliani (another leading French jumps jockey) booked. The stable often runs multiple strong chances in these events, and Zuliani is frequently used for top prospects. Market support is expected, and the connections alone justify shortlist inclusion.

shortlist.name: Noire Wulf (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Should be prominent in the betting due to the presence of champion jockey James Reveley.
shortlist.rationale: James Reveley is a multiple French champion jockey and rarely rides outsiders, especially for established trainers. The combination suggests this runner is expected to be competitive, and market support is likely.

shortlist.name: Parisimix (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Shortlisted based on current market—no longshot odds observed.
shortlist.rationale: Bryony Frost is a high-profile jockey with a strong record in France, and M. Seror is a respected trainer. The lack of published form is a concern, but market support and connections suggest readiness and ability. No evidence of needing major improvement.
shortlist.confidence: Moderate—connections and market support are positives, but absence of form data limits confidence.

shortlist.name: Great Parade (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Included due to absence of outsider odds and strong trainer reputation.
shortlist.rationale: Y. Fouin is a leading French jumps trainer, often well-prepared at Compiegne. Market does not indicate outsider status. While form is not listed, the stable's strike rate and typical race placement suggest this runner is competitive.
shortlist.confidence: Moderate—trainer strength and market position are key, but lack of recent form tempers confidence.

shortlist.name: Tante Zena (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Prominent in current market; not a longshot.
shortlist.rationale: Represents a top local trainer with a leading jockey booking, suggesting strong stable confidence. Market support indicates genuine winning chance, and connections have a solid record at this venue.

shortlist.name: Reims (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Well-supported in betting; considered a main contender.
shortlist.rationale: Comes from a respected dual trainer partnership known for preparing winners at Compiegne. Current odds reflect stable confidence and suggest the horse is expected to be competitive.

shortlist.name: Glorice (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Expected to be at or near the top of the market based on trainer and jockey combination.
shortlist.rationale: Represents the leading yard of Francois Nicolle, who is highly successful at Compiegne and in French jumps racing. Angelo Zuliani is a top jockey for the stable. Even without published form, this combination is consistently competitive in these events and rarely sends unfit or unready horses at this level.

shortlist.name: Impressive (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Likely to be a principal market rival given the powerful Lageneste & Macaire operation.
shortlist.rationale: The Lageneste & Macaire stable is a perennial force in French jumps, especially with young or unexposed types. Their runners are typically well-prepared and competitive in this grade. Market support is expected, and the stable rarely wastes entries at this level.

shortlist.name: Game Of Storm (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Should be prominent in the betting due to connections.
shortlist.rationale: Another Nicolle runner, this time with Kevin Nabet, another top French jumps jockey. The stable/jockey combination is highly effective, and dual representation from Nicolle suggests strong stable confidence. Likely to be well-fancied and fit.

shortlist.name: Celtic Warrior (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Expected to be among the market leaders based on trainer's record at Compiegne.
shortlist.rationale: D. Sourdeau de Beauregard is a respected trainer at this venue, and Clement Lefebvre is a capable jockey. The stable is known for targeting these races with live contenders, and the lack of published form is not unusual for French jumpers at this stage of the season.

shortlist.name: Capbello Dino (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Market leader on early books; strong connections.
shortlist.rationale: James Reveley is a top jockey in France, and the George/Zetterholm team is highly respected. Capbello Dino is prominent in early markets, suggesting stable confidence and likely readiness. No major negatives on profile.

shortlist.name: Darling De Chamdou (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Well found in early markets; solid yard.
shortlist.rationale: Peltier stable is reliable at Compiegne and Lefebvre is a capable rider. Market support indicates expectation of a strong run. No evidence of needing major improvement.

shortlist.name: Raffles Cipriani (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Short in early betting; notable UK jockey booking.
shortlist.rationale: Bryony Frost is a high-profile jockey, and the booking signals intent. The yard is respected and the horse is not considered an outsider by the market.

shortlist.name: Lacokokeldy (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Prominent in early market; not a longshot.
shortlist.rationale: Represents top French jumps trainer Francois Nicolle, whose runners are consistently competitive at Compiegne. Kevin Nabet is a leading jockey in France, often booked for stable's best chances. Market support suggests strong connections and stable confidence.

shortlist.name: Lorenzo Conti (Fr)
shortlist.rationale: James Reveley is one of the most successful foreign jockeys in France, regularly riding winners for Hugo Merienne. The combination is respected in French jumps racing, and market position confirms expectations for a bold run.

shortlist.name: Lola Des Mottes (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Solid market support; not a longshot.
shortlist.rationale: Gabriel Leenders is a rising force in French training ranks, and Felix de Giles is a proven jockey with a strong record in similar events. Connections are in form and the horse is expected to be fit and ready, as indicated by market confidence.

shortlist.name: Snow Face Princess (Usa)
shortlist.odds_note: Expected to be among the market leaders based on top connections and typical market support for Asmussen/Prat at Aqueduct.
shortlist.rationale: Trained by Steven Asmussen, a leading US trainer, and ridden by Flavien Prat, one of the most reliable jockeys in New York. This combination is highly effective at Aqueduct. Even without published form, the connections alone suggest strong readiness and intent, especially in a field lacking standout recent form.

shortlist.name: Should've (Usa)
shortlist.odds_note: Ward runners with Rosario are typically well found in the market, rarely overlooked by bookmakers.
shortlist.rationale: Wesley Ward is renowned for preparing horses to win on debut or off a break, especially at New York tracks. Joel Rosario is a top jockey with a strong record for Ward. The lack of form is not a negative given Ward's strike rate with newcomers and the likely market respect.

shortlist.name: Bella Knows (Usa)
shortlist.odds_note: Brad Cox runners are consistently short in the market, especially with Franco up at Aqueduct.
shortlist.rationale: Brad Cox is one of the most successful trainers in the US, and his horses are almost always competitive in these conditions. Manuel Franco is a leading local jockey. Even without visible form, the connections and typical market support make this runner a strong contender.

shortlist.name: Power Of Pearls (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Prominent at 1.18 on exchange, indicating strong market support.
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with two placings and a close fourth, suggesting reliability and readiness. Connections are respected, and the market rates this runner highly.

shortlist.name: Princess Of All (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Well-supported at 1.18, indicating strong market confidence.
shortlist.rationale: Runner-up on debut, showing immediate ability. With natural improvement expected and strong connections, this filly is a leading contender.

shortlist.name: Gaslight Dancer (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Placed third and fourth in last two starts, indicating consistency at this level. Top jockey booking and solid trainer add to appeal.

shortlist.name: Pivotal Role (Saf)
shortlist.trainer: J. J. van Vuuren, South Africa
shortlist.rationale: Produced a runner-up finish on debut, suggesting immediate ability and scope for improvement. Trained by a respected yard and partnered with a top jockey. The market rates this runner highly, and the profile is progressive with no need for major improvement.

shortlist.name: Bingo (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer with multiple placings at this level. Proven reliability and experience in the grade, with a strong jockey booking. The form is solid and the horse is holding condition, making it a logical contender.

shortlist.name: Ringho (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Regularly in the frame, showing consistent ability at this level. Connections are in form and the horse's profile suggests reliability without needing significant improvement. Market support is notable.

shortlist.name: Windsor Silk (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Exchange odds 1.18, indicating strong market support.
shortlist.rationale: Lightly raced with a win last time out, suggesting rapid improvement and potential for further progress. Connections are in good form and the market rates this runner highly.

shortlist.name: Inafix (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Exchange odds 1.18, well-fancied in the market.
shortlist.rationale: Recent win two starts ago and consistent form figures indicate reliability at this level. Trainer and jockey combination is respected locally.

shortlist.name: Mamlambo (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Very short odds (1.01 exchange), clear market leader.
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile with two wins and a second from last three starts, indicating strong current form. Top connections and market support reinforce confidence. No signs of regression or need for major improvement.

shortlist.name: Daisy Jones (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Well-supported at 1.18 exchange, among the market principals.
shortlist.rationale: Recent win and consistent form figures suggest upward trajectory. Trainer in good standing and horse is not exposed. Should be competitive at this level.

shortlist.name: Chantilly Dream (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Prominent in the market at 1.18 exchange.
shortlist.rationale: Lightly raced with a win and a third from three starts, indicating potential for further progress. Top jockey booked and no evidence of needing major improvement.

shortlist.name: Kisshoten (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Consistently short at 1.48 on exchange, indicating strong market confidence.
shortlist.rationale: Has been highly consistent this season, placing in the top three in all but one recent start and winning twice. The form figures show reliability and fitness, and the connections are strong. Market support at short odds confirms expectations.

shortlist.name: It's Her Way (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Arrives in peak form with back-to-back wins, suggesting improvement and readiness. The trainer and jockey are both capable, and the recent form is among the best in the field.

shortlist.name: Warning Sound (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile with two wins in last three starts, including a recent victory. The trainer is in good form and the horse is clearly improving, making this runner a strong contender.

shortlist.name: Rosy Lemon (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with a win and several competitive finishes; top jockey booking and trainer in form. No major improvement needed, and odds reflect strong market support.

shortlist.name: Bob Lee Swagger (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Recent win two starts back and placed efforts show current ability; form is solid for this grade. Connections are reliable and odds indicate strong chance.

shortlist.name: Zoombomber (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Has shown ability with a win and a second last season; recent runs suggest fitness and potential to return to best. Top jockey and trainer combination adds confidence.

shortlist.name: Enflame (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Current exchange odds 1.18; among the market leaders.
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile with two wins and a second from last three starts, indicating peak form and fitness. Trainer and jockey are both reputable, and the horse is proven at this level. No sign of regression in recent runs.

shortlist.name: The Ultimate King (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Current exchange odds 1.18; well-supported in the market.
shortlist.rationale: Ultra-consistent, with three consecutive wins followed by a close second. Strong connections and a profile suggesting continued competitiveness at this level. Recent form is rock-solid.

shortlist.name: Luce Verde (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Current exchange odds 1.18; respected in the betting.
shortlist.rationale: Recent win and third from last two starts, indicating upward trajectory. Connections are capable, and the horse is holding form well. No evidence of needing major improvement.

shortlist.name: Dylan's Champ (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Very short at 1.01, clear market leader.
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with two runner-up finishes and a win in last six starts. Top connections and the market's overwhelming support suggest strong confidence. No signs of decline in form and proven at this level.

shortlist.name: Futurewolff (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Solidly supported at 1.18, joint second favorite.
shortlist.rationale: Recent win and consistent placings indicate reliability. Jockey/trainer combination is respected. Form suggests ability to compete for the win if favorite underperforms.

shortlist.name: Follow The Master (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile with two wins and two seconds in last four starts. Stable in excellent form and runner is peaking at the right time. Should be in the mix based on recent improvement.
